paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted variants in the TTR gene with penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: ATTR amyloidosis, with variable clinical manifestations including polyneuropathy and cardiomyopathy

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The onset can vary from the 2nd to the 6th decade of life.
Late onset TTR V30M patients show loss of both small and large fibers.

functional_data.summary: In vitro studies show that TTR V30M variant leads to increased amyloidogenic potential.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in regions with high prevalence.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical and functional studies.
variants.additional_notes: The TTR V30M variant is the most frequent and well-studied variant associated with ATTR amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The most frequent TTR variant is TTR V30M that causes ATTRV30M amyloidosis.
The clinical expression of the disease is highly heterogeneous in ATTR amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text.
